135.description: About the same size as the Eurasian magpie perching bird with black, bluish, black; bill: bright orange-red, conical; back: duller violet-blue; breast: black; underparts: greyish cream; wings: violet-blue, rounded; tail: brighter violet-blue, broad, white tip, long; legs: bright orange-red; eyes: a ring around each eye is bright orange-red. Habitat: evergreen forest and scrub in predominantly hilly or mountainous country, adapted to urban habitat.

136.description: Small streamlined with plain, dark brown, white; bill: black, long and pointed; back: dark brown; breast: dark brown; underparts: dark brown; wings: dark brown, broad; tail: dark brown, long; legs: black; eyes: brown. Habitat: pools with plenty of vegetation, lakes and river deltas, rice fields or other flooded areas where trees and shrubs can be found, waters with higher salinity in estuaries or on barrier lakes. Juveniles: similar to adults but may have lighter plumage.

137.description: Small slender with distinct black face mask, forehead and v-shaped band across the chest, mottled brown, white; bill: red with black tip, short and pointed; back: mottled brown; breast: white, v-shaped band across the chest; underparts: white; wings: mottled brown, white bar, pointed; tail: grayish-brown, short; legs: pale orange; eyes: dark. Habitat: edges of freshwater sources including wetlands, lakes, dams and billabongs, as well as shallow, temporary claypan pools; occasionally mudflats and estuaries. Juveniles: duller in colour with a greyish beak and lacking the black breast band and forehead.

138.description: Medium-sized large wader with orange or reddish; bill: yellow, heavy yellow beak with a down-curved tip; back: whitish; breast: black with white scaly markings, distinctive black breast band with white scaly markings; underparts: whitish; wings: black with a greenish gloss, long tertials tipped in bright pink, white tips of black coverts giving the appearance of white stripes; tail: black with a green gloss, short; legs: yellowish to red but often appear white. Habitat: freshwater wetlands, irrigation canals, and crop fields, particularly flooded rice fields during the monsoon. Juveniles: mainly whitish with grey bills and blackish facial skin, assumes a brownish plumage.

139.description: Especially small rounded with gray, white; bill: black, short and pointed; back: grey-brown; breast: white; underparts: white; wings: gray, rounded; tail: darker than body, white tail end markings, long; legs: dark gray; eyes: ruby red. Habitat: native and exotic forests, shrubs, suburban areas with vegetation. Juveniles: yellowish feathers around the face and underbody, brown eye.

140.description: 35–42 cm (14–17 in) rounded body with red, white; bill: bluish grey, short and stout; back: black; breast: dark gray; underparts: black; wings: black, broad; tail: dark gray, short; legs: black; eyes: red. Habitat: freshwater lakes and ponds. Juveniles: paler than the adult, has a whitish breast, and lacks the facial shield.

141.description: Similar to the American robin similar to the American robin with brown, light gray; bill: dark gray, short and conical; back: brown; breast: light gray; underparts: light gray; wings: brown, rounded; tail: brown, slightly forked; legs: pinkish; eyes: dark brown. Habitat: wooded habitats in eastern and northern South America, from Brazil, Colombia to Uruguay, with localized population in the west; very common in human inhabited parts of its range, often nesting in garden shrubs and small trees. Juveniles: similar to adult but with more mottled plumage.

142.description: 18 to 19 cm (7.1 to 7.5 in) long and weighs between 53 and 65 g (1.9 and 2.3 oz) with bright green with a bluish wash on the crown, bluish, orange; bill: pale, pale; back: bluish green; breast: bright green; underparts: mostly bright green with bluish vent and thighs; wings: brown, brown wing coverts that show as 'shoulders' when perched; tail: bluish green; eyes: white eye ring. Habitat: semi-open to open landscapes including Llanos, deciduous woodland, secondary and gallery forest, plantations, and treed parts of towns. It shuns evergreen forest.. Juveniles: similar to adults.

143.description: Medium slender with black cap, black, white; bill: dark gray, short and conical; back: grayish-brown; breast: white; underparts: white; wings: grayish-brown, rounded; tail: grayish-brown, short crest; legs: dark gray; eyes: dark. Habitat: subtropical or tropical moist lowland forests. Juveniles: similar to adults but with less distinct black cap and duller plumage.

144.description: 10 cm (3.9 in) round with small red patch in front of both eyes, scarlet / brown, scarlet / brown; bill: pink, short and conical; back: scarlet / brown; breast: scarlet / brown; underparts: scarlet / buff; wings: brown, rounded; tail: scarlet / brown, short; legs: gray; eyes: dark. Habitat: open grassland and cultivation. Juveniles: brown plumage with no distinct red coloration.

145.description: 12.5–14.5 cm (4.9–5.7 in) rounded with grey with white on the sides, brown, black; bill: short dark, short dark; back: grey-brown, striped; breast: white; underparts: white with brown on the flanks; wings: greyish, striped, short; tail: greyish, long notched. Habitat: coniferous woods in Canada, Alaska, and the northernmost portions of the contiguous United States. Juveniles: similar to adult but with less distinct patterns and duller colors.

146.description: 11–14.5 cm (4.3–5.7 in) slender with black mask, bright yellow / olive-brown, black / yellowish; bill: black / pinkish-brown, short, strong, conical; back: yellowish-green / greenish-yellow, streaked darker; breast: bright yellow / pale yellow; underparts: bright yellow / off-white; wings: brown, pointed; tail: brown, short and square; legs: pinkish brown; eyes: brown or red-brown. Habitat: shrubland, savanna, grassland, open woodland, inland wetlands, semi-desert areas, sub-urban gardens and parks. Juveniles: like the female.

147.description: 15–17 cm (5.9–6.7 in) stocky with black mask, yellow / olive, black; bill: black, strong conical; back: black and yellow / streaked olive, striped / streaked; breast: yellow; underparts: yellow / pale yellow; wings: yellow and black, striped, pointed; tail: brown, short and square; legs: pinkish; eyes: dark reddish. Habitat: open or semi-open habitats, including woodlands and human habitation. Juveniles: like the female, but browner on the back.

148.description: Sparrow-sized slender with striped, black, white; bill: black / horn-colored (light gray), conical; back: brown, striped; breast: white, faint brown spotting; underparts: white; wings: brown, striped, pointed; tail: brown, short; legs: pinkish; eyes: dark. Habitat: dry regions with woodland or wooded grassland, thornveld and scrubby, dry riverbanks. Juveniles: pinkish-brown bill.

149.description: Small slender with striped, brown, white; bill: dark, fine; back: white V, unstreaked; breast: orange, unstreaked; underparts: white; wings: brown, striped, longer primary projection; tail: brown, short; legs: dark; eyes: dark. Habitat: wet grassland, soft mud, intertidal mudflats, muddy margins of freshwater lakes. Juveniles: more contrasting mantle plumage and weaker white lines down the back than little stint.

150.description: Small shank with plain, grayish-brown, white; bill: dark, long fine bill; back: greyish brown, white wedge up its back; breast: white, diffuse small brownish spots; underparts: white; wings: brown, spotted, pointed; tail: brown, short; legs: yellowish; eyes: dark brown. Habitat: open grassy steppe and taiga wetlands. Juveniles: brownish plumage with spotted patterns on upperparts and streaked breast.

151.description: Small slender with olive-brown, pale yellow; bill: dark, yellowish, wide; back: olive; breast: washed with olive; underparts: whitish; wings: olive-brown, white wing bars, pointed; tail: olive-brown, long and narrow; eyes: white. Habitat: deciduous forests, often near water, across the eastern United States and southwestern Ontario. Juveniles: similar to adult but with more mottled plumage.

152.description: Very large large and powerful with dark brown, white with sparse blackish-brown spotting; bill: pale greenish, medium size; back: dark brown; breast: white with sparse blackish-brown spotting; underparts: white with sparse blackish-brown spotting; wings: dark brown, pale streaked with black, long broad wings with relatively narrow rounded tips; tail: uniform brown, similar barring as the remiges, short; legs: pale greenish; eyes: rich yellow. Habitat: open woods and woodland edges, wooded savannah and thornbush habitats. Juveniles: pearly gray colour above with considerable white edging, speckled grey effect on crown and hind neck, entire underside conspicuously white, wing coverts mottled grey-brown and white, patterns of bars on primaries and tail that are similar to adult but lighter and greyer.

153.description: Small short-tailed with bronzy-black, blue-green glossy; bill: black, long narrow; back: blue-green glossy; breast: white, wider white breastband / slender white strip; underparts: red-orange; wings: glossy metallic-green, dark black spots on the median and greater coverts; tail: white, short; legs: black; eyes: creamy-white. Habitat: savanna, thornbush and acacia arid areas, open woodland, lakeshore woodlands, gardens and cultivated fields. Juveniles: duller plumage, no glossy sheen except on the tail and wing feathers, brown iris turning grayish white, pale yellowish bill with darkening on the tip, brown legs.

154.description: About 17 cm (6.7 in) slim, elongated-looking with buff barred with brown; bill: brown, long and slender with a broad base and sharp tip; back: barred and mottled in shades of pale brown with rufous and blackish bars and wider black streaks, barred and mottled; breast: creamy white, arrow-heads which are reduced to spots on the lower breast; underparts: creamy white with brown markings; wings: brown, rufous-buff markings; tail: grey, speckled with brown, with faint bands of greyish-brown and a few more clearly defined bands of brownish-black, rounded; legs: pale brown; eyes: hazel. Habitat: open countryside, parkland, gardens, orchards, heaths and hedgerows, especially where there are some old trees; may also inhabit deciduous woodland and in Scandinavia it also occurs in coniferous forests. Juveniles: much similar to the adults but with a milder and less distinct coloration.

155.description: Large mid-sized rather broad-bodied raptor with plain pale, creamy rufous to light sandy with at most a few darker streaks; bill: dark, relatively large bill on a smallish head, long and heavy; back: dark brown with sandy buff streaks, conspicuous sandy-brown mantle and wing coverts with dark feather-eters causing a contrasting effect; breast: pale, pencil thin streaks; underparts: darker rufous-brown; wings: dark brown with sandy buff streaks, contrasting effect with dark feather-eters, long broad wings with fairly straight edges and only slightly tapering hands with rounded five-fingered end; tail: light rufous-orange, fairly rounded shape; legs: dull yellow; eyes: very dark brown. Habitat: open, uncultivated areas, with high bushes, trees, cliffs or hillocks, arid areas, steppe, semi-desert, desert edge, barren rocky landscapes, dry shrubland, sea coasts, slightly hilly plains, grasslands during winter. Juveniles: similar to respective adults of their morphs but tend to possess neater, paler edging above, especially on the tips of the greater and median coverts, more streaky about the head and breast, tail going from pale whitish darkening outwards to grey-brown with irregular faint brown bars, dark morph juveniles less dark than the adult of that morph, sometimes evidencing a small paler patch on breast, tail pattern differs from the dark adult, generally browner with 3 very broad bands and a slightly broader subterminal band.

156.description: Small streamlined with brown, white; bill: black, short and pointed; back: blue; breast: white, heavy dark streaking; underparts: white; wings: brown, long and narrow; tail: brown, deeply forked. Habitat: open, often hilly, areas with clearings and cultivation. Juveniles: duller and browner, with a paler rump and shorter outer tail feathers.

157.description: 1.7–4 kg (3.7–8.8 lb) geese-like with plain, brown, white; bill: black at the base and tip, with an orange band across the middle, short and stout; back: brown, streaked; breast: white, streaked with brown; underparts: white; wings: dark brown, narrow white fringes to the feathers, broad; tail: black, short and square; legs: bright orange; eyes: dark brown. Habitat: northern Europe and Asia (breeding), further south in Europe and Asia (wintering). Juveniles: similar to adults but may have less distinct coloration and patterns.

158.description: Medium-large swan-like with white, white; bill: darker, redder, long and flat; back: white; breast: white; underparts: white; wings: white, black tips to the outer six primary feathers, broad; tail: white, short; legs: pink; eyes: red. Habitat: well-vegetated lagoons, freshwater swamps, and sometimes human-made reservoirs. Juveniles: blue-grey bills and feet and black striping running down the length of their bodies (to aid in camouflage from predators), with this eventually fading by about eight months of age.

159.description: 16.5–17 centimetres (6.5–6.7 in) long slender with striped, brown, light brown; bill: dark brown or blackish, short and pointed; back: smoky-olive, weakly streaked with darker brown, weakly streaked; breast: buff, heavily marked with poorly defined brown streaks; underparts: buff; wings: brown, streaked, longer-winged than meadow pipit; tail: brown, streaked, short; legs: dark; eyes: dark brown or blackish. Habitat: rocky coasts, typically below 100 metres (330 ft). Juveniles: resemble the adult, although they may sometimes be browner and more streaked above, looking superficially similar to meadow pipits.

160.description: Very large longest and largest winged vulture in its range with bare, wrinkled, pinkish or bluish; bill: horny yellow, massive; back: blackish, lined with brown; breast: white, spotted or streaked with dark brown; underparts: pure white to buff-brown; wings: blackish, white lining the wings, large, broad wings held with the front edges held parallel and slightly pointed, serrated-looking wingtips; tail: dark brown, uniform, 33-36 cm (13-14 in); legs: grayish; eyes: dark brown. Habitat: dry savannah, thornbush, arid plains, deserts with scattered trees in wadis, open mountain slopes, undisturbed open country with a scattering of trees, areas with minimal grass cover. Juveniles: similar to adults but with darker plumage and less distinct white underparts.

161.description: About 25 cm (10 in) compact with iridescent, blue-green, blue-green; bill: black, short and stout; back: greenish-blue, iridescent; breast: blue-green, iridescent; underparts: blue-green; wings: blue, iridescent, rounded; tail: blue, iridescent, short and square; legs: black; eyes: yellow. Habitat: open woodland, plantations, savannah, bushveld, rough grassland, parks and gardens. Juveniles: duller plumage compared to adults, less iridescent.

162.description: Medium-sized rounded with bright red / small dull yellow crown stripe, bright red / yellow; bill: dark gray, short and conical; back: dull dusky red / brownish olive; breast: red / brown, somewhat paler below / paler and greyer below; underparts: somewhat paler below / paler and greyer below; wings: brown, rounded; tail: brown, short and square; legs: grayish; eyes: dark. Habitat: thick undergrowth at the edge of forest, second growth or abandoned plantations at altitudes from sea level to 600 m (2,000 ft). Juveniles: brown and lack the throat and crown patches.

163.description: 45–52 cm (18–20 in) in overall length with a wingspan of 112–122 cm (44–48 in) streamlined with plain, dark brown, white; bill: pale yellow with a dark patch near the tip, slender and pointed; back: brownish-grey with most feathers fringed with a lighter brown; breast: white; underparts: mostly white with a brown border which is most prominent of the trailing edge of the wing; wings: darker brown, more white on the primary feathers at the wingtip, in particular the outermost large feather (P10), long and narrow; tail: dark brown, upper tail-coverts are tipped whitish, square-tipped; legs: pale flesh colour; eyes: dark brown. Habitat: breeds on rocky islands and on steep coasts in the Mediterranean; forages in the Atlantic outside the breeding season. Juveniles: brownish plumage with lighter underparts.

164.description: Large ground-dwelling with striped, black, white; bill: yellow, pointed; back: brown; breast: white; underparts: white; wings: brown, white bar, rounded; tail: white, tipped black, short; legs: yellow; eyes: dark. Habitat: wet lowland habitats, especially damp grassland. Juveniles: similar to adult but with less distinct patterns and duller colors.

165.description: Small slender with plain, black / blue-gray, white; bill: black, thin; back: dusky gray / gray; breast: white; underparts: dusky gray / white; wings: gray, white bars, rounded; tail: black / gray, white tips and edges on the underside / white edges, long, thin; legs: black; eyes: dark brown. Habitat: coastal sage scrub, dry habitats including Baja California desert and Gulf of California xeric scrub. Juveniles: grayish-brown plumage with lighter underparts.

166.description: Less than 10 cm (3.9 in) slender with iridescent / plain, glossy metallic bluish to purplish black / olive brown, purplish black / yellow; bill: black, down-curved; back: glossy metallic bluish to purplish black / olive brown, plain; breast: purplish black / yellow, bordered with green / plain; underparts: purplish black / yellowish; wings: dark brown / brown, pointed; tail: blue-purple / brown, dark and short square ended, square ended; legs: gray; eyes: darkish. Habitat: thin forest and garden land, including those in dense urban areas. Juveniles: just like females in plumage, however, the males get black feathers as they become adults.

167.description: Small rounded with striped, gray, white; bill: orange, conical; back: gray; breast: brown, streaked with black; underparts: brown; wings: gray, streaked with white, rounded; tail: gray, short and square; legs: grayish; eyes: dark brown. Habitat: subtropical or tropical dry forests, subtropical or tropical dry shrubland, subtropical or tropical high-altitude shrubland, and heavily degraded former forest. Juveniles: similar to adults but duller, with less distinct streaking and a paler bill.

168.description: 38 to 41 cm (15–16 in) ground-dwelling with plain / striped, brown, white; bill: black with some pale yellow from the nostril to the base, heavy; back: brown, spotted / striped; breast: white, spotted; underparts: white; wings: brown, spotted / striped, broad and blunt; tail: brown, striped, short; legs: pale greenish yellow; eyes: greenish yellow with black tracing. Habitat: edges of lakes, estuaries and rivers, mangroves, sheltered beaches, and nearby woodlands. Juveniles: similar to adult but with more mottled plumage.

169.description: Small compact with black band across forehead, chestnut, white; bill: black, thicker-billed (in comparison to semipalmated plovers); back: brown; breast: white, black breast band; underparts: white; wings: dark, white wing bar, rounded; tail: brown, white sides, short; legs: yellow. Habitat: sandy coasts, estuarine mud, inland riverbanks and open sandy savannas. Juveniles: lack any black on the head, and the breast band is replaced by brown patches on each side of the chest.

170.description: 35 to 41 cm (14 and 16 in) corvid with black, black; bill: black, powerful; back: purplish-blue; breast: black; underparts: black; wings: purplish-blue, rounded; tail: purplish-blue, long; legs: yellow; eyes: yellow. Habitat: dry deciduous forest. Juveniles: Juvenile males remain with the group for a year or so before dispersing, while females may remain indefinitely with the group..

171.description: 16.5 to 18 cm (6.5 to 7.1 in) long with white supercilium, dark sooty brown to blackish brown face, dark sooty brown to blackish brown, white; bill: black, stubby; back: plain brown to olive-brown; breast: bright yellow; underparts: bright yellow; wings: deep grayish brown, dull olive edges on inner secondaries, thin rusty or cinnamon-rufous edges on outer secondaries and inner primaries, thin rufous margins on the rest of the primaries; tail: dusky brownish, light olive edges on the feathers; legs: black; eyes: brown. Habitat: cultivated areas, clearings and pastures with shrubs, gallery forest, edges of more extensive forest, along rivers and oxbow lakes, ranches, parks, and gardens near water. Juveniles: similar to adults but with no yellow on the crown and more rusty-cinnamon edges on the wing and tail feathers.

172.description: Medium slender with dark blue / gray, dark blue / gray; bill: black, short and pointed; back: dark grey; breast: dark blue / gray; underparts: dark grey; wings: dark blue / gray, pointed; tail: dark blue / gray, long and deeply forked, long and deeply forked; eyes: crimson. Habitat: tall forest habitat. Juveniles: dull brownish grey.

173.description: Large streamlined with iridescent green, iridescent green, white; bill: red, long, thin, curved; back: purple; breast: white, spotted black; underparts: dark green; wings: dark green, white markings, pointed; tail: purple, white chevrons, very long, diamond-shaped; legs: grayish; eyes: red. Habitat: forests, woodlands and suburban gardens of most of sub-Saharan Africa. Juveniles: immatures have a black bill.

174.description: Large woodpecker-like with striped, brown, red / white; bill: gray, chisel-like; back: brown, spotted; breast: white, spotted; underparts: white; wings: brown, spotted, rounded; tail: brown, square. Habitat: Sonoran, Yuma, and eastern Colorado Desert regions of the Southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico, including all of the Baja California peninsula except the extreme northwestern region. Juveniles: similar to adult but with less distinct patterns and colors.

175.description: 53–58 cm (21–23 in) distinctive eagle with long, shaggy crest with long, shaggy crest, blackish-brown, blackish-brown; bill: yellow, paling to white; back: blackish-brown; breast: blackish-brown; underparts: blackish-brown; wings: black with white patches, black barred with light grey and broad black tips, white patches; tail: black, barred with pale grey; legs: yellow, paling to white; eyes: bright yellow, can be darker in females. Habitat: forest edges and moist woodland, near grassland, marsh, rivers or streams; also found in drier woodland, mixed farmland, grazing land, edges of sugar-cane plantations and orchards, exotic plantations. Juveniles: similar to adults, but plumage is lighter in colour and the crest is not developed, eyes are grey.

176.description: Tiny heron-like with striped, black with a faint green sheen / brownish black, white; bill: yellow, long and sharp; back: black with a faint green sheen / brownish black, paler feather margins visible at close range; breast: pale buff, streaked with dark buff and brown; underparts: pale buff; wings: black, pinkish buff oval shaped panel, broad; tail: black with a faint green sheen / brownish black, short; legs: yellow; eyes: yellow. Habitat: reedbeds, rushes or bushes above the water. Juveniles: duller and more rufous than the females, more heavily streaked on both their upperparts and underparts, including their wing coverts.

177.description: Very large heron-like with chestnut, white; bill: black, long and thick; back: slate grey; breast: white with black streaks, streaked; underparts: buff with black streaks; wings: slate-grey, chestnut shoulder patch, broad; tail: short; legs: black; eyes: yellow. Habitat: lakes, swamps, mangrove wetlands, reefs with few cool water, sometimes river deltas. Juveniles: similar to adults, but paler.

178.description: Smallest of the skua family streamlined with plain, black, white; bill: black, slender and pointed; back: grey; breast: white; underparts: white; wings: grayish-brown, dark primary wing feathers without a white 'flash', long-winged; tail: white, very long tail, very long tail; legs: dark; eyes: dark brown. Habitat: high Arctic of Eurasia and North America, breeding grounds; open ocean outside of breeding season. Juveniles: slimmer, longer-winged and more tern-like than parasitic jaeger, with greyer shades rather than brown.

179.description: Tiny slender with solid / plain, red / olive green, red / yellowish; bill: black, medium-length thin down-curved; back: maroon / olive-green; breast: crimson / yellowish; underparts: olive / yellowish white; wings: black / brown, short; tail: green-blue / brown, white tips to the outer tail feathers, long and slightly forked; legs: gray; eyes: dark brown. Habitat: forest and cultivated areas. Juveniles: brownish with less vibrant colors compared to adults.

180.description: Small slender with brown, whitish; bill: dark gray, fairly long, slender; back: grey-brown; breast: whitish; underparts: warm buff; wings: rufous-brown edges, rounded; tail: brown, white tip and a dark subterminal band, long, narrow, graduated; legs: orange; eyes: dark. Habitat: shrubs and grass in a variety of habitats including woodland, savanna and cultivated areas. It adapts well to man-made habitats.. Juveniles: pale yellow underparts and a yellowish bill.

181.description: 14.5 to 15 cm (5.7 to 5.9 in) slender with white, white; bill: black, short and pointed; back: brownish gray; breast: white; underparts: white; wings: black, white fringes on the tertials, rounded; tail: black, white feather tips, long and narrow; legs: black; eyes: dark. Habitat: somewhat open shrublands near freshwater bodies, especially marshy areas and rice fields, banks of ponds, lakes, streams, and rivers, occasionally in nearby open grasslands, increasingly found in urban and suburban parks in Brazil.

182.description: Medium stocky with plain, black, white; bill: red, stocky; back: black, plain; breast: white; underparts: white; wings: black, barred, broad; tail: dark grey, barred, long and graduated; legs: black; eyes: yellow. Habitat: coastal and riverine forests of southern (only the eastern coast) to northeastern Africa. Juveniles: similar to adults but with duller plumage and smaller bill.

183.description: Small rounded body with black cap, black / slate-gray, white; bill: black, short and pointed; back: olive green; breast: white; underparts: white / greenish yellow; wings: olive green with white wing bars, white wing bars, rounded; tail: olive green, short and square; eyes: brownish-red. Habitat: shinneries, brushy areas with scattered trees, primarily consisting of shin oak or sumac. Juveniles: First-year males often have more extensive gray in the cap, similar to adult females.

184.description: Medium-sized with white, white, white; bill: red upper mandible and black lower mandible, large; back: bright blue; breast: white; underparts: white; wings: bright blue, black with white underwing coverts, indistinct white wingbar; tail: bright blue; legs: dark grey. Habitat: a variety of wooded habitats with some trees, especially Acacias, including around human habitation. Juveniles: duller than adults and have a brown bill.

185.description: Small slender with plain, brown, rufous; bill: black, short and pointed; back: brown; breast: rufous; underparts: yellowish-white; wings: blackish, serrated edge of the outer primary feathers; tail: blackish, slightly forked; legs: black; eyes: dark brown. Habitat: open areas and forest clearings. Juveniles: similar to adults but may have less distinct coloration.

186.description: Medium-sized similar in general appearance to turkeys with dark grey, white; bill: black, slender and slightly curved; back: grayish brown; breast: white; underparts: paler; wings: bright chestnut, rounded; tail: blackish, tipped with buff, long broad; legs: long strong; eyes: dark. Habitat: humid landscapes characterized by dense vegetation such as thickets, secondary forest, brushy abandoned fields, and thinned forests. It shuns the interior of dense forest though it can occur in their edges.. Juveniles: browner overall, especially on the head.

187.description: Small parrot-like with spectacles, green, green; bill: pinkish-white, curved; back: green; breast: green; underparts: green; wings: green, rounded; tail: green, short; legs: orange; eyes: dark. Habitat: lowland evergreen forest edge, thorn scrub, llanos, gallery woodland, and heavily degraded former forest or low-density woodland. Juveniles: similar to adults but duller in coloration.

188.description: Relatively small plump with brown face with a pale blue ring of bare skin around the eye, metallic green to blue / darker brown, black / paler brown; bill: mostly bright yellow to yellow-green, short and stout; back: metallic green to blue / mostly brown; breast: paler brown with a white band below the upper breast, sometimes with a thin white band below the upper breast; underparts: yellow; wings: flight feathers, primary coverts, and secondary coverts are various patterns of black and white, lesser wing coverts metallic green to blue, rounded; tail: upper side mostly dark reddish brown with a wide black band at the end, underside has narrow black and white bars, long and square; legs: bluish gray; eyes: dark brown. Habitat: the understory to mid-story in the interior of humid primary forest and mature secondary forest, favoring areas near streams, sometimes in terra firme forest or associated with stands of Guadua bamboo. Juveniles: resemble the adults but are duller, and young males have a brown throat, breast, and wing coverts.

189.description: 10.2 to 14 cm (4.0 to 5.5 in) slender with metallic bronze-green / metallic green, black; bill: black, slightly decurved; back: metallic bronze-green / metallic green; breast: metallic bluish green / green; underparts: bronzy green / white and green; wings: grayish brown, pointed; tail: dusky bronze green and rufous, innermost pair dusky bronze green, outer four pairs rufous with a wide purple base and whitish tips, forked. Habitat: gallery forests, shade coffee and cacao plantations, edges of dense forest, parks and gardens in populated areas. Juveniles: somewhat similar to adult females but have a white chin, throat, and breast with a thin black central line, some brown on the head and back feathers giving a barred appearance, lower back and rump feathers with dull cinnamon-buff tips, juvenile females with some rusty or buff beside the white of the underparts, green undertail coverts, and a mostly dull carmine underside of the tail.

190.description: Small slender with dark brown, white; bill: black, short and pointed; back: dark brown; breast: white; underparts: white; wings: dark brown, pointed; tail: dark brown, long and fanned; legs: dark gray; eyes: dark. Habitat: a wide variety of forest and scrub, including parks, agricultural lands, and other degraded habitat. It resides in lowland areas, sometimes up to 800m in elevation, and is usually found near water. Juveniles: similar to adults but may have less distinct coloration and patterns.

191.description: 23 cm long with white on the forehead, sides of the face and neck, crimson; bill: slate black, long; back: glossy black, large white patch on the shoulder; breast: buffish white; underparts: buffish white; wings: black, white spots forming three wingbars; tail: black, few white spots on the three outer tail feathers, short stiff; legs: greenish grey. Habitat: open woodlands, cultivation with trees and scrubs, and parks. Juveniles: no crimson on the nape, but the crown is crimson.

192.description: Small rounded with bill: short and conical; wings: rounded; tail: short and square. Habitat: subtropical or tropical moist lowland forest, subtropical or tropical swamps, and heavily degraded former forest.

193.description: Small rounded body with black cap, white cheeks, black, white; bill: short black, short; back: gray; breast: paler grayish, whitish band below the bib; underparts: paler grayish; wings: gray, white wing bars, rounded; tail: gray, short. Habitat: wooded highlands.

194.description: Similar in size to a reed bunting slender with heavily streaked brown, black / brown, white; bill: pink, lower mandible, short and conical; back: brown, heavily streaked; breast: reddish / white, band / spotted; underparts: white; wings: brown, streaked, pointed; tail: brown, streaked, short; legs: pink; eyes: dark. Habitat: wet coniferous woodland.

195.description: 18 to 21 cm (7.1 to 8.3 in) long with red only on the very back of the crown, red, black with white spots; bill: blackish, short; back: bronze-green with brownish black bars, bars; breast: dull olive-yellow with a reddish tinge, spots; underparts: dull olive-yellow; wings: brown with pale barring and yellow shafts, bars; tail: brown with green to yellow bars on outer feathers, bars; legs: greenish gray sometimes with a yellowish tinge; eyes: rufous brown. Habitat: humid lowland landscapes both open and wooded, prefers sparse woodlands, rainforest, deciduous and gallery forest, várzea, mangroves, llanos, palm savanna, and palm, shade coffee, and other treed plantations. Juveniles: generally duller than adults, have greener upperparts, and have larger spots on their underparts.

196.description: Small slender with greenish gray / white; bill: long and slender; back: greenish; breast: solid green; wings: pointed; tail: oval to round flags, elongated outer rectrices with bare shafts and long terminal oval flags; legs: white. Habitat: temperate and subtropical Andes, edges of humid to wet forest, forest interior, more open secondary forest.

197.description: Small slender with black and white, white, white; bill: black, short and pointed; back: black; breast: white; underparts: white; wings: black, white patches, pointed; tail: black, long and narrow; legs: orange-red; eyes: yellow. Habitat: subtropical or tropical dry forests, dry savanna, moist savanna, and subtropical or tropical dry shrubland.

198.description: Medium-sized slender with mottled brown and black, brown, white / light brown; bill: black, very short; back: grey, black and brown, mottled; breast: light brown, spotted; underparts: grey and black; wings: brown with darker bars, barred, pointed; tail: brown with white tip, white tips on the outer tail feathers / banded, long and slightly forked; legs: dark; eyes: dark. Habitat: deciduous or mixed woods across central and southeastern Canada and the eastern United States. Juveniles: similar to adult but with fluffier plumage.

199.description: Medium-sized plump with black with a broad white border that runs from behind the eye, around the black ear-coverts and chin, and joins at the throat, black, white; bill: black, short and stout; back: black; breast: white, two black bands, with the lower band shaped in an inverted horseshoe; underparts: white; wings: black, white stripe, rigid; tail: black, short; legs: black; eyes: black. Habitat: coastal Patagonia, including Argentina, Chile, and the Falkland Islands. Juveniles: grey-blue backs, with a more faded grey-blue colour on their chest, and usually have a blotched pattern on their feet which fades as they grow up into adulthood.
